image.altText: NT DV thumb

props.synopsis: A litany of failures by Northern Territory police led to the collapse of an alleged domestic violence case against one of its own detectives.

title.children: 'Gross incompetence': How NT police botched alleged DV case against detective

image.altText: A banner reading 'Coles' and, in the background, the Woolworths logo.

props.synopsis: The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission launches legal action against Woolworths and Coles, alleging the supermarket giants breached consumer law by misleading consumers through discount pricing claims on hundreds of products.

title.children: 'The conduct we are considering is very serious': ACCC launches action against Coles and Woolworths

image.altText: jigsaw 4

props.synopsis: Perhaps no question matters more to households worn down by cost of living pressures, but the answer is not straightforward.

title.children: The four numbers that could tell us when interest rates will go down

image.altText: a middle-aged male police officer in uniform outdoors

props.synopsis: Lawyers allege several Aboriginal NT Police officers experienced racial vilification, derision and an unequal pay system on the job. The police commissioner says it's a "positive step" that they have the confidence to speak up.

title.children: NT police commissioner pledges 'reform', after Aboriginal officers lodge human rights complaint

image.altText: a grey industrial building in a darwin street

props.synopsis: A 32-year-old man who allegedly stole a car from a Darwin smash repairs shop at knifepoint has been arrested by Northern Territory police.

title.children: Man, 32, allegedly stole car at knifepoint from Darwin smash repairs shop

image.altText: Rose Staleo

props.synopsis: The banking royal commission described the way in which mortgage brokers are paid as "conflicted remuneration" and "money for nothing". Customers don't care.

title.children: Three in four home loans are written by mortgage brokers, infuriating banks and delighting customers

image.altText: Children hands on fence

props.synopsis: The federal government has tightened its $170 million ABSTUDY funding program following allegations of abuse, fraud and neglect at one Indigenous hostel.

title.children: Indigenous student hostel closes after allegations of abuse, neglect and forced labour

image.altText: White 4 wheel drive car submerged past wheels in rushing river at night.

props.synopsis: A rescuer says the Victorian driver was "lucky to walk away" from the mishap in the state's south, warning other outdoor enthusiasts to take care as the school holidays begin.

title.children: Off-roaders warned against over confidence after risky night-time river crossing goes wrong in WA

image.altText: Donald Trump holds up a fist. A crowd is behind him.

props.synopsis: Former president Donald Trump says that he will not make a fourth consecutive run for the US presidency if he loses the upcoming election.

title.children: 'That will be it': Trump says he will not run again if he loses in November

image.altText: A cloud of white smoke rises in the distance behind a village on a hillside near the border between Lebanon and Israel

props.synopsis: Israel and Hezbollah exchange heavy fire, with Israeli warplanes carrying out the most intense bombardment in almost a year of war across Lebanon's south and Hezbollah firing rockets deep into northern Israel.

title.children: Hezbollah and Israel exchange heavy fire in what Hezbollah says is now an 'open-ended battle of reckoning'

image.altText: Lachlan Murdoch stands at a lectern to give a speech, the projection of a US flag behind on screen

props.synopsis: Rupert Murdoch's court battle with his children is about more than money. He's fighting to keep his media empire conservative

title.children: 'The day Rupert dies is the day Lachlan gets fired': The words that rocked the Murdoch empire

image.altText: A person wearing a keffiyeh holds their fingers up in a peace sign, a Palestinian flag is in the background.

props.synopsis: Among the many words spoken about Palestinians fleeing Gaza in our febrile domestic political debate about visa checks and national security, we have heard very little about the hatred — both private and at times public — that some Gazans feel about and toward Hamas.

title.children: The complicated politics of the Israel-Gaza war continue to mount in Australia

image.altText: Senator McKim is mid sentence while standing in the Parliamentary Press Gallery.

props.synopsis: The demand that the treasurer intervene to cut rates unless governor Michele Bullock does so herself effectively sinks Jim Chalmers's chances of passing his reforms.

title.children: Greens demand hostile takeover of RBA in exchange for passing board reforms in likely death knell to treasurer's bill

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX is set to decline 0.8pc after Wall Street's rate cut rally came to a halt on Friday. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX set to slip 0.8pc after Wall Street rate cut rally stalls

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, Narenda Modi, Joe Biden and Fumio Kishida stand in a line next to each other.

props.synopsis: Here's four things Anthony Albanese's trip revealed about the Quad, leadership, language and life lessons.

title.children: Four takeaways from the prime minister's 48 hours in the US for the Quad

image.altText: A man, photographed from behind so his face isn't visible, looks downcast

props.synopsis: When Ezekiel landed in Australia as a guest worker two years ago, he was full of hope. Two years later, he is in limbo, destitute and homeless with the company that sponsored him being investigated for abuse and mistreatment of workers.

title.children: Crisis point in regional towns as modern slavery overwhelms local services

image.altText: A notebook with the words "Susan Bartlett Suzanne Armstrong murders of 147 Easey St Collingwood"

props.synopsis: Detectives have been praised for collecting and preserving DNA materials during the original Easey Street investigation at a time when little was known about the use of the science in criminal cases.

title.children: Police investigating the Easey Street killings lauded for using a forensic practice that was yet to prove its worth

image.altText: A man with black hair and a short beard smiles widely while waiving at the camera

props.synopsis: The 55-year-old's win comes after he pledged to fight corruption and fix the country's fledgling economy.

title.children: Marxist-leaning Anura Dissanayake elected as Sri Lanka's new president after historic run-off vote

image.altText: Cameron Smith is sprayed with champagne

props.synopsis: Australia's Ripper team of Cam Smith, Lucas Herbert, Matt Jones and Marc Leishman claimed a total prize of $20 million by winning the LIV Golf League for the first time.

title.children: $20m payday for Aussie LIV golfers after team victory

image.altText: Kim Jong Un speaks in front of microphones with a red and yellow flag in the background

props.synopsis: Kim Jong Un runs the 'model dictatorship' in North Korea. Here's how he got here.

title.children: 'Publicly executed to send a message': The brutal regime of Kim Jong Un

image.altText: hand pulling condom out of pocket.

props.synopsis: New sexual consent laws come into effect from today, along with the criminalisation of stealthing.

title.children: Stealthing will be criminalised in Queensland from today. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: Devni Vihara posing on a green lawn

props.synopsis: Women of Asian backgrounds reveal they've been told to "not be so ambitious" by earning more money than their partners.

title.children: Devni was told 'not to threaten' her ex-boyfriend's place by earning more money than him

image.altText: Moody objects inside a dimly lit home

props.synopsis: Dev spent two nights in a motel before he was placed in a refuge, but with one in two young people getting knocked back from crisis accommodation, he considers himself lucky.

title.children: Dev entered a refuge soon after fleeing abusive home life. He considers himself lucky

image.altText: A young mum with brown hair taking a selfie with her young son, who has long blonde hair

props.synopsis: Children living with disability are over-represented in school suspensions and a new report has shed light on their cost to families and the broader economy.

title.children: Kids with disability suspended from school 'before an inspector comes' or as 'warning to other children'

image.altText: A small green parrot with a yellow belly and reddy brown eye against a grey background.

props.synopsis: Around half of the nation's total known night parrots live in a patch of the Great Sandy Desert in Western Australia. While dingoes appear to protect them, the potential effects of a proposed road are less clear.

title.children: Australia's largest night parrot population may be protected by dingoes, but mining is planned for their desert home

image.altText: Graphic of Chinese and American flags side by side.

props.synopsis: In the battle for power and influence in Asia, one report says the size of a country's military isn't all that matters.

title.children: China and the US are battling for power in Asia. Which country is on top might surprise you

image.altText: Lando Norris holds his index finger up, signifying victory, with fireworks in the background

props.synopsis: Lando Norris has continued McLaren's Formula 1 charge, winning the Singapore Grand Prix and narrowing his deficit to Max Verstappen in the drivers' championship.

title.children: Norris lands another blow to Verstappen in F1 title fight with Singapore win

image.altText: Apalachee High School in Winder, Georgia

props.synopsis: Four people have died and at least 21 were wounded during a shooting in a nightlife area in Birmingham, Alabama.

title.children: Four killed and dozens wounded in Alabama nightlife district shooting

image.altText: Two men taking a selfie inside a plane.

props.synopsis: The family of kidnapped New Zealand pilot Phillip Mehrtens expresses thanks to all parties involved in his release, including the Indonesian rebels for taking care of him during more than a year and a half in captivity.

title.children: 'Extremely grateful and relieved': Family reacts to the release of New Zealand pilot kidnapped by Indonesian rebels

image.altText: Ambulances and workers stand near a mine in Iran

props.synopsis: A gas explosion in a coal mine in Iran's South Khorasan province kills at least 31 people and injures 16.

title.children: Methane blast at Iran coal mine leaves at least 31 dead

image.altText: Ben Zygier

props.synopsis: A new documentary aims to shed more light on the case of Prisoner X, who was identified as Australian man Ben Zygier. He'd been working as a spy for Mossad but his alleged crimes remain shrouded in secrecy.

title.children: How the man known as 'Prisoner X' went from suburban Melbourne to the heart of Mossad

image.altText: Two police officers take notes while talking to an unidentified woman.

props.synopsis: Coercive control can be "hidden in plain sight", according to training being rolled out to police officers, which seeks to help officers see a broader picture of family violence.

title.children: 'I was in shock': This domestic violence victim was labelled the perpetrator, but there's hope for new police training

image.altText: A small white dog wearing a green knitted jacket and sitting on a grey couch.

props.synopsis: NSW Premier Chris Minns said he hoped the bill, which will be introduced to parliament next month, would "make things a bit less stressful for renters".

title.children: Renters with pets big winners in state government shake-up
